words.ENTRY: <H>under</H><audio>under.mp3</audio><PS>preposition</PS><D>in or to a position that is below or beneath something:</D> <X>Put the suitcase under the bed.</X><dot><X>to hide under the table</X><dot><X>The dog crawled under the fence and ran into the street.</X>
universitynouncountable (plural universities) the highest level of educational institution, where students study for degrees and where people do academic research

<H>up</H><su>1</su><audio>up.mp3</audio><PS>preposition;</PS> <PS>adverb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to a high or higher level or position:</D> <X>The monkey climbed up the tree.</X><dot><X>I carried her suitcase up to the third floor.</X><dot><X>I walked up the hill.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>into an upright position:</D> <X>Everybody stood up when the judge entered the courtroom.</X><dot><X>I had to get up early.</X><NR>3.</NR><D>further along:</D> <X>I live just up the street.</X><NR>4.</NR><D>(used for showing that sth is increasing):</D> <X>Prices have gone up.</X><dot><X>Turn the volume up.</X><H>up</H><su>2</su><audio>up.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS>(not before a noun) <CF>be up</CF> <D>awake and not in bed:</D> <X>Aren't you up yet?</X>
uspronoun(used as the object of a verb, or after be) me and another person or other people; me and you: Come with us.Leave us alone.Will you write to us?Hello, it's us again!

useverb(present participle using; past, past participle used) 1.when you use something, you do something with it for a purpose: Could I use your phone?We used the money to buy a house.This information cannot be used for commercial purposesUse your imagination!That's a word I never use.2.to need or to take something: Don't use all the milk.
<H>usually</H><audio>usually.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>in the way that is usual; most often:</D> <X>She's usually home by six.</X><dot><X>Usually, we go out on Saturdays.</X>
